findings.title: Token Scarcity
findings.description: Reviews for issues of token scarcity requires manual review. Check for these conditions: No user owns most of the supply, The total supply is sufficient, Tokens are located in more than a few exchanges, Users understand the associated risks of large funds or flash loans, and The token does not allow flash minting.

findings.title: No user owns most of the supply
findings.description: If a few users own most of the tokens, they can influence operations based on the token's repartition.

findings.title: The total supply is sufficient
findings.description: Tokens with a low total supply can be easily manipulated.

findings.title: Tokens Located in Multiple Exchanges
findings.description: If all the tokens are in one exchange, a compromise of the exchange can compromise the contract relying on the token.

findings.title: Users understand the associated risks of large funds or flash loans
findings.description: Contracts relying on the token balance must carefully take in consideration attackers with large funds or attacks through flash loans.

findings.title: The token does not allow flash minting
findings.description: Flash minting can lead to substantial swings in the balance and the total supply, which necessitate strict and comprehensive overflow checks in the operation of the token.

findings.title: Business risk of a lost or stolen key
findings.description: Theft of keys could mean a complete loss of funds or trust in the market due to unauthorized access to key material.
